channel.title: Hosting 2 servers at the same time
channel.description: How could I do this? Anthony was supposed to do this for my project but it seems he never is going to finish so I just want to know how I could do this. Then i would need to know how to edit the clients so diff clients (but technically the same base and such) could know which server to connect to.

item.title: Hosting 2 servers at the same time
item.dc:creator: @Mercifies Mercifies
item.description:
@Mercifies wrote:

Also make sure you port forward for the second server port you are going to open. Just a reminder.

Read full topic

item.title: Hosting 2 servers at the same time
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

marcbob:

How do i make the server run on a diff port? Like you said for the client i could just search 43594 and change all of those to 5555 but what about the server?

Look in the server class.

The first server should be 43594, the second should be changed to something other then 43594.

Read full topic

item.title: Hosting 2 servers at the same time
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“marcbob, post:1, topic:337866”]How could I do this? Anthony was supposed to do this for my project but it seems he never is going to finish so I just want to know how I could do this. Then i would need to know how to edit the clients so diff clients (but technically the same base and such) could know which server to connect to.[/quote]Chippeh is correct.

This is basically the same way as having two worlds. You can have one world be port 43594, and the other be 43595.

Read full topic

item.title: Hosting 2 servers at the same time
item.dc:creator: @chippeh chippeh
item.description:
@chippeh wrote:

Notice how a regular server runs on port 43594? In order to run 2 servers you need to open another port and rune the server on that port. Port 5555 is usually used for a second server.
All you need to do in your client is pretty much copy it and change in client.java all the 43594’s to 5555. Make sure your port is open and run the server on port 5555, and/or 43594.

That help?

Read full topic
item.source: Hosting 2 servers at the same time
